intro: Centaurium behen, commonly known as lesser centaury, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Centaurium behen is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
